messages: 677487cda1559e94553229a74b33f235 (14:08): Something about me still being with her despite her ugly website says something about tehe website not mattering
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:36): Hello everyone! I'm new to Macs. Can anyone tell me, where I can find the Keys missing on a typical Mac keyboard? (like the tilde, pipe, braces, etc) Thanks
1a827fb0665bd56bbe340cbd754dd704 (14:37): tilde
1a827fb0665bd56bbe340cbd754dd704 (14:37): is in the top left
1a827fb0665bd56bbe340cbd754dd704 (14:37): where you'd expect tilde
1a827fb0665bd56bbe340cbd754dd704 (14:37): pipe is on the right, where you'd expect pipe
1a827fb0665bd56bbe340cbd754dd704 (14:38): i'll let you figure out where braces are
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:38): lol
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:39): What type of keyboard where you using before ?
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:39): They are pretty much identical to "windows" keyboards bar different naming for option and command
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:43): I just bought a MacBook. The keys are quite where I was expecting them :-)
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:43): are=aren't
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:44): It's a german keyboard - forgot to mention that ;-)
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:44): Not really up on the german layouts ;)
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:45): I found the pipe: It's alt-7
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:45): Doesn't it share a key with backslash like "US" keyboards ?
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:46): The tilde is alt-n
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:46): it has no backslash
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:46): Weird
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:47): Hehe your layout is called Quertz ?
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:47): alt-shift-7 is the backslash!
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:48): yup it's qwertz
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:48): ahh qwertz
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:48): I'm just holding down the modifier keys and pressing all the keys.
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:49): It's still weird. I don't think I could get used to having to use modifier keys for them
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:49): I'm getting the wierdest keycodes.
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:49): Yes this'll be quite irritating at first
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:50): But this laptop is mainly for presentation purposes
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:50): so I just might have to correct some typos. Otherwise, I take it along just to look good :-D
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:51): ‚Ä¶and it works
ef9a149abde30003b2ec38f9aa34ce34 (14:51): mm
ef9a149abde30003b2ec38f9aa34ce34 (14:51): better

ef9a149abde30003b2ec38f9aa34ce34 (14:54): KDElson: reminds me of one of those "special" keyboards
ef9a149abde30003b2ec38f9aa34ce34 (14:54): that like, try to make typing comfortable or some stuff
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:54): This is not quite my keyboard :-)
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:54): Yeah, they just annoy me because I use so many different machines i like there to be a fairly standard layout
a3efd4e55dee24eefe46255343410920 (14:55): If you write in germany you need the missing letters on the alphabet, that US keyboards don't have, like ???§?º?ü
5ed6cffb90ef64a716b7cb274fcfe4bb (14:56): Yeah, I don't have the correct character set enabled I just get weird symbols :P
